intro: Chrysobotrya intermedia, commonly known as the yellow starburst, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble stars. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branching. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
